intro: Goniothalamus suluensis, commonly known as the Sulu tamarind, is a tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in lowland to montane forests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
